reviews.review_msg: She's the nicest and her courses are always so positive and inspiring. If you get the chance to take a class with her, I highly recommend it.

Just take this class if you need a GPA boost!  All assignments are easy to do and are quite often based on your thoughts and experiences. No final exam, just a take home exam and all you have to do is create a rubric and evaluate a portfolio you made in class using the assigments already done in the course! You'll have no stress if you take it!
Awesome class if you're interested in delving into self reflection as a means of becoming a better teacher.

Online course. I've never contacted her, always contacted her TA who was awesome (but it's not him who I am grading). Also, the website wasn't well, I always had to go to different places to get all this information I needed for an assignment, and I contacted my TA for most of them. If she still has the same TA as I've had, you'll be just fine.

EDUC 326 is  a complete joke.  I don't feel I learned anything about classroom management and discipline.  All we did was a bunch of ridiculous self-reflection. Total fluff!  We were continually graded on our self-reflection! The marking scheme is also inconsistent.  BAD course!

Avoid this class! The grading scale is extremely high. 85 is a B? The assignments are marked too academically. I've consistently received A's in upper division writing courses, but did not receive any mark higher than 8.5/10 on the assignments, even when I worked my butt off.

I took her online course and found out she designed the course to be a complete act of hypocrisy.  The class entitled "Classroom Management" was based almost entirely on Type theory.  Although in her notes she talks about the importance of getting to know students, she made no effort at all to be involved with that class.

Not a fan. I took her correspondence course on classroom management and was disappointed to find the ENTIRE course was based on type theory and fluffy little personal narratives from her life with absolutely NO practical information on classroom management. Easy grading, but useless course.

Idealistic, passionate, and zealous...not in a good way.  The course was biased, unbalanced, and I got a B on my huge portfolio assignment, dragging down what could have been 95% overall to 87%.  And mostly because I had trouble taking any of the material seriously.

Addisu was unreasonable with his students in this online course. He scheduled short quizzes on weekends (sat-sun), 5qs long, worth 1% of our overall mark for each q. Despite being asked to adjust the schedule, it took a heavy push for him to do so. Group assignments were unfairly weighted & groups were assigned by himself. Grading scale was tough.
Very nice prof and very kind and helpful. Takes constructive criticism well.

This is a course on reflection, not classroom management.  Very heavy workload.  Lorna is a challenging professor, but is also very flexible and deeply respects individuality.  The recent posting is a bit harsh.  Lorna has a high expectation level of education students; she wants you on the path that leads to self-discovery and higher learning.

Vague in directions, then critical of mistakes. Always refers to online material instead of material available in class, making it difficult for those not on a laptop. Teaches Classroom Management, but the class is mutinous and she doesn't understand why. I would never wish this on anyone, as she is condescending, patronizing, and sarcastic. Avoid!
great teacher, if you pay attention, and follow his rubrics
Don is a great prof, I love his style of teaching. He is always there to answer questions and he never belittles his students.

Extremely easy credit. Paula is forthcoming and excited about what she teaches. Graded on 5 open book quizzes (can retake 3 times), and 5 assignments. No lectures just readings (which you don't really need to read besides for assignments. Marking is fair. If you put in effort, you'll get a great grade so it's definitely a gpa booster.

What a joke! Not really hard but changes assignment instructions at the last minute of the course and doesn't even post it on the assignments page! She instead decides to place the changes made in an essay long email that realistically no student wants to read! And then we get penalized! Hopefully she will be more intelligent going forward!!!
